text: Romani Gypsies in Finland belong to the eastern Kale group and settled in Finland at the end of the sixteenth century. Numbering about 11,000-12,000 the Finnish gypsies live mostly in urban areas. Although some of Finlandâ€™s gypsies still speak their Kale dialect of the Romani Gypsy language, most Finnish Gypsies speak Finnish.Roma - Minority Rights Group ==References== ==Other websites== *World Directory of Minorities and Indigenous Peoples - Finland : Roma Category:Roma Category:Finland
title: Romani people in Finland
